text: today guys I'm sharing something super
delicious with you I know I know
everything is always super delicious but
today extra special it's an eclair cake
with a homemade vanilla pudding and
chocolate frosting you're going to love
it that was 1 cup of sugar 1/2 a cup of
cornstarch
pinch of salt and then whisk those dry
ingredients together once these are
fully combined you can add 8 large egg
yolks and then 4 cups of whole milk
sugar and cornstarch will both dissolve
in the milk so you can see no more lumps
then add the rest of the milk it's 4
cups total and 4 tablespoons of unsalted
butter now all you need to do is cook
this sort of a medium high heat usually
is what we recommend and bring it to a
boil whisking pretty much constantly and
here what we're doing is we're making a
vanilla custard just the filling for our
Eclair cake oh my gosh you guys look how
thick this got it's amazing how quickly
it happens it hasn't even fully come to
a boil yet but because I've been
whisking constantly it's still nice and
smooth you want to cook the cornstarch
out so you want to cook this at a boil
for about a minute don't stop stirring
now though because this is when it would
burn on the bottom if that was going to
happen which is not going to happen
because you're gonna be stirring
constantly now add 2 teaspoons of pure
vanilla extract whisk it in and then you
want to strain it just to make sure
there are no lumps so strain it through
a fine sieve this needs to chill get
nice and cold so when you're done just
place a piece of plastic wrap directly
on the surface of your pudding or
custard this will prevent a skin from
forming as its chilling and then get it
into the refrigerator take at least two
hours but you can leave this over
night to finish off your cake you want
to make a ganache this is 8 ounces of
semi-sweet chocolate and 1 cup of hot
cream pour that right over and then just
let it sit so that the chocolate melts
that's your frosting leave that for a
second
here's my pastry cream give it a whisk
it's been sitting in the refrigerator so
it's stiffened up and you want to loosen
it a little bit before you fold in some
whipped cream get out any lumps that
might have formed and then this was a
half a cup of heavy cream that's now
been whipped so it's about a cup I like
to loosen just a little bit by adding
some of the whipped cream fold in the
rest of the whipped cream I'm going to
fully combine but as light as possible
now to layer I've put a layer of graham
crackers in the bottom of this 9 by 13
inch cake pan and now I'm adding half of
my pastry cream mixture spread with an
offset spatula a nice smooth layer and
then top with another full layer of
graham crackers you want to be able to
get three layers out of the three
packages that come out of a 14 ounce box
now one more layer of cream dollop
spread this layer out final layer now
you can stir together your ganache which
is probably perfect at this point should
weigh about 5 minutes for the chocolate
to melt great nice and smooth now pour
this over the top and then spread it in
an even layer to cover the entire top
you don't want it too hot or too loose
because then it'll just ooze all over
the place this is the perfect
consistency because it's spreadable and
still warm but not flying all over the
place this is like all my favorite
things
pastry cream chocolate ganache whipped
cream you just can't go wrong that's it
back into the refrigerator let it set
for a couple of hours and you are good
to go you can make
this the day before - if you want - it's
so so fantastic and really one of the
easiest starts you'll ever make I'd say
something else but my mouth is full
match
